gpat_q: Antimuscarinics are used in the treatment of the following disorders EXCEPT:
Epinephrine decreases intracellular camp levels by acting on:
Which of the following barbiturates is an ultra-short-acting drug?
reason: Barbiturates are generally divided into four groups based on their duration of effect: ultra‐short‐acting (e.g., methohexital, thiopental), short‐acting (e.g., pentobarbital, secobarbital), intermediate‐acting (e.g., amobarbital, butabarbital), and long‐acting (e.g., phenobarbital, primidone).

opt_2: It is as effective as morphine for a short-term relief from moderate to severe pain
